=== Installing Bridge ===

==== Via PPA ====
A <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~bridge/+archive/daily|PPA]]</nowiki> is available:
<pre>
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:bridge/daily
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install bridge
</pre>
Bridge is designed to run at startup. Once installed, you need to log out and log in.

Or run it manually by executing
<pre>
/opt/bridge/bridge-daemon
</pre>

==== Installing from trunk ====

<pre>
bzr branch lp:bridge
</pre>
Then starting it:
<pre>
./bridge/bridge-daemon
</pre>

=== Installing more Zeitgeist Data-Sources ===

The accuracy of Bridge is relative to the number of installed applications being able to notify Zeitgeist of their activity. In Ubuntu 12.04, only a few of them do it by default and it is recommended to install more Zeitgeist Data-Sources before installing the Bridge.

<pre>
bzr branch lp:zeitgeist-datasources
cd zeitgeist-datasources
./autogen.sh
make
make local-install
</pre>

* <nowiki>[[http://wiki.zeitgeist-project.com/index.php?title=Installing_Zeitgeist_Dataproviders_from_trunk|Installing Zeitgeist Data-Sources from trunk]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/zeitgeist-datasources|Zeitgeist Data-Sources in Launchpad]]</nowiki>

==== Browser extensions ====

===== Firefox =====
The Firefox Zeitgeist extension, which is available from the previous method, can also be found packaged:
<pre>
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:markjtully/ppa
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install zeitgeist-datasource-firefox
</pre>

===== Chrome =====
The Chrome/Chromium extension is available on the Chrome Web Store: 
 <nowiki>[[https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/cckhkmhbknngejnoepfopckjlbnpookg|Zeitgeist Plugin]]</nowiki>
